rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative directly modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment reports factual economic data ('will produce', 'represents an annual output increase') without high-potency framing.
The segment uses future verbs ('will produce', 'represents') with scale, but Q3 requires realised impact and excludes financial metrics.
The segment does not contain a loaded rhetorical question.
This segment reports production projections but contains no explicit calming language.
Segment does not contain a minimiser used with scale contrast for reassurance.
The segment does not contain a bare negation.
Describes future production projections ('Brazil will produce up to 14.9 million tons... and up to 15.35 million tons').
